node.title: New in Paperback: ‘The Fabric of Civilization’ and ‘The National Road’
node.description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

node.title: Michael Nesmith, the ‘Quiet Monkee,’ Is Dead at 78
node.description: He shot to fame as a member of a made-for-TV rock group, but he denied that he was the group’s only “real” musician. He went on to create some of the first music videos.

node.title: What Would a Post-Roe America Look Like?
node.description: Legal scholars, researchers and writers consider how the country could be transformed.

node.title: Scuba-Diving YouTuber Finds Car of Teens Missing Since 2000
node.description: A YouTuber who investigates cold cases found a missing Tennessee teenager’s car submerged in a nearby river. It is at least the fourth such discovery by amateur investigators in two months.

node.title: Biden Lauds Dole at Funeral, Says He ‘Lived by a Code of Honor’
node.description: “Bob was a man who always did his duty,” President Biden said of the former senator during a funeral service in Washington.

node.title: Modernization of Notre-Dame Interior Gets Green Light
node.description: A commission of heritage experts approved proposals to bring in contemporary art and move some furniture to make more space for visitors. Critics say it will debase the centuries-old church.

node.title: U.S. Sanctions China, Myanmar, North Korea Over Surveillance, Human Rights Abuses
node.description: A Treasury Department official said it "is using its tools to expose and hold accountable perpetrators of serious human rights abuse."

node.title: Trump-Appointed Judge Says 8 Lawsuits Challenging Georgia's New Election Law Can Proceed
node.description: U.S. District Judge J.P. Boulee allowed for eight lawsuits against Georgia's new election to move forward, but several are similar and he may consolidate them.

node.title: Uber Working With Florida Authorities to Track Down Those Who Conned Grandparents
node.description: Grandparents in two separate cases were instructed to withdraw money before someone came to collect it using the ride-sharing service.

node.title: Drivers in Some States Face Delays as Snowplow Drivers Quit Over Low Pay, Vaccine Mandates
node.description: Snowplow drivers across the country are leaving the job for higher-paying, less dangerous positions with private companies, creating a shortage in many states.

node.title: Ex-Cop Nicholas Hanning Pleads Guilty to Using Taser on 75-Year-Old Man, Causing Stroke
node.description: A former Colorado police officer pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor assault charge and will never be allowed to work in state law enforcement again.

node.title: Lockdown blamed for rise in delayed cancer treatment, diagnosis
node.description: Health professionals are warning backlogs due to lockdown are causing a rise in delayed cancer diagnosis and treatment. Audio

node.title: Make This Parm
node.description: Hetty McKinnon’s mushroom Parmesan is a streamlined vegetarian take you’ll make again and again.

node.title: Joe Biden Wants to Send More Direct Payments to Americans in 2022
node.description: If Build Back Better passes, Americans could see additional payments through next year.

node.title: Final accuser takes stand at Ghislaine Maxwell trial, using her real name
node.description: Farmer took the stand using her true identity — a departure from the decision by three other accusers with similar stories who testified under pseudonyms.

node.title: The Documents You Need to Travel Abroad Now
node.description: The pandemic has created a whole new checklist of what you should bring on your trip. Here’s the essential paperwork you need to have in your bag.

node.title: Magnus Carlsen Pounces on Rival’s Mistake to Retain Chess Title
node.description: Carlsen’s victory came after the latest in a series of blunders by Ian Nepomniachtchi that completed one of the worst collapses in a title match in chess history.

node.title: Iran Warns Military Option Doomed 'to Fail' as U.S., Israel Talk Deal 'Alternatives'
node.description: "We'll continue our peaceful nuclear program and exercise our right of self-defense in the face of any act of aggression against our territory," Iran's U.N. mission told Newsweek.

node.title: Kathy Hochul Forces New York Businesses to Choose Between Vaccines or Mask Mandates
node.description: Governor Hochul's announcement comes as New York state's seven-day average COVID-19 case rate has increased by 43 percent since Thanksgiving.

node.title: NY Gov. Kathy Hochul Issues Indoor Mask Mandate, Says She Warned It Could Happen
node.description: "I have warned for weeks that additional steps could be necessary," she said during a press conference announcing the statewide mandate.

node.title: Letitia James Remaining Attorney General in New York Spells Trouble for Donald Trump
node.description: James has been involved in two high-profile investigations of the Trump Organization and has noted that she sued the Trump administration 76 times.

node.title: ER overwhelmed with unvaccinated COVID patients
node.description: The surge in new COVID-19 cases almost all are related to the Delta Variant ​which still accounts for more than 99% of all new cases.

node.title: Rethinking U.S. Rules on International Travel
node.description: Readers discuss testing requirements and suggest a quarantine. Also: Outdoor dining; universal pre-K; Roe v. Wade; machines and morality; Gil Hodges.

node.title: ‘Rockin’ All Over The World’ With a Diplomat’s Road Trip Music
node.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken, an amateur guitarist, offers a playlist of global tunes with resonance for his official travels.

node.title: While the Country Worries About the Omicron Variant, Delta Dominates Hospital ICUs
node.description: More than three million people in the United States have been hospitalized with COVID-19 since August.

node.title: Who Is Geoffrey Fieger? Columbine Attorney Representing Oxford School Shooting Victims
node.description: Fieger has represented families in cases involving the Columbine school shooting and the Flint, Michigan, water crisis.

node.title: Halle Berry on directing her first movie "when destiny knocked "
node.description: "Bruised" marks yet another milestone in Halle Berry's historic three-decade career.

node.title: California to ticket high-pollution trucks, lawn mowers
node.description: "What we're really talking about here is the smog ... that is making people sick and killing people," one advocate said of new regulations.

node.title: Review: For Once, Singing of Complete and Utter Clarity
node.description: “Voices of the Immaculate,” a new cantata by Kati Agocs performed on Thursday by Lucy Dhegrae, was entirely, word for word, lucid.

node.title: The Best Graphic Novels of 2021
node.description: This year’s crop of comics art included experimental storytelling and flights of stylistic fancy.
